    Inner function that is the same as getBestName, but it does not add the selected index to usedStrings.

Static Private Attributes

  • bestLanguageCodeMap m_bestLanguageCodeMap
    The best StringTable::languageCode for a LangTypes::language_t and the distance for it.
  • PreferedLanguageCont m_preferedLanguage
    The languages to select before defaulting to english or just any language.

Detailed Description

Class consisting of static functions to be used for selecting the best name of e.g.

an Item or Searchable.

StringTable::languageCode NameUtility::getBestLanguage (  LangTypes::language_t  lang,
uint32 &  dist
)  [static]
 

Get the best languageCode for a language_t.

Parameters:
lang The language_t to get best language for.
dist Set to the distance between the languages, 0 if same language in languageCode as in language_t.

int NameUtility::getBestName (  int  nbrNames,
const uint32 *  stringIdx,
const vector< LangTypes::language_t > &  reqLangs,
set< uint32 > *  usedStrings = NULL,
bool  acceptUniqueName = true
)  [inline, static]
 

Returns the best name for an item.

This function will always return a name unless the number of names is 0.

Parameters:
nbrNames The number of names in the array.
stringIdx The stringIndices.
reqlangs The requested languages to use.
usedStrings Raw stringIdx for already used strings that should not be used again. Selected index will be added.
acceptUniqueName Wether unique names should be returned,
See also:
ItemTypes::uniqueName.
Returns:
Index in array to the best name. -1 if no allowed names.

uint32 NameUtility::getLangPoints (  LangTypes::language_t  itemLang,
LangTypes::language_t  reqLang
)  [inline, static]
 

Compare two languages and return large value if the difference is small.

The order of the inparameters may be important in the future. <br /> FIXME: Use better method inside.

Returns:
The number of points, maximum of maxStringPoints.

Definition at line 233 of file NameUtility.h.

Referenced by getBestName(), getBestNameOfType(), and innerGetBestNameOfType().

int NameUtility::getName (  int  nbrNames,
const uint32 *  stringIdx,
LangTypes::language_t  reqLang,
ItemTypes::name_t  reqType,
set< uint32 > *  usedStrings = NULL
)  [inline, static]
 

Returns the index of a name and prefers names of the requested name and type.

Calls getExactName(), then getBestNameOfType() and last getBestName().

Parameters:
nbrNames The number of names.
stringIdx The raw string idxes.
reqType The requested type.
reqLang The requested language.
usedStrings Raw stringIdx for already used strings that should not be used again. Selected index will be added.
Returns:
Index of the best name or -1 if no names.

Definition at line 604 of file NameUtility.h.

LangTypes::language_t NameUtility::getNumberNameValue (  const char *  name  )  [inline, static]
 

Returns the name priority in language code for a number name.

This is to be able to use the language as a value of the priority of that number name. (language of roadNumbers was always invalidLanguage.)

Parameters:
name Name string
Returns:
Language type representing name priority.
